required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Investigational Drug on Clinical Outcomes in Patients With Aortic Stenosis (Narrowing of the Major Blood Vessel of the Heart)(MK-0653A-043 AM4)(COMPLETED)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled Study to Evaluate the Effects of Ezetimibe + Simvastatin on Clinical Outcomes in Patients With Aortic Stenosis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate whether treatment with an investigational drug as compared to placebo will reduce the risk of major cardiovascular events in patients with aortic stenosis.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants That Experienced One or More Components of the Composite Clinical Endpoint of MCE (Major Cardiovascular Events)
primary_outcome.description: Composite endpoint of MCE consists of cardiovascular death, AVR (aortic valve replacement) surgery, CHF(congestive heart failure) as a result of progression of aortic stenosis, nonfatal MI (myocardial infarction), CABG (coronary artery bypass) surgery, PCI (percutaneous coronary intervention), hospitalized unstable angina, and nonhemorrhagic stroke

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants That Experienced One or More Components of the Composite Clinical Endpoint of AVE (Aortic Valve Events)
secondary_outcome.description: Composite endpoint of AVE (aortic valve events) consists of AVR surgery, CHF (as a result of progression of AS), or cardiovascular death

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants That Experienced One or More Components of the Composite Clinical Endpoint of ICE (Ischemic Cardiovascular Events)
secondary_outcome.description: Composite endpoint of ICE (ischemic cardiovascular events) consists of cardiovascular death, nonfatal MI, CABG, PCI, hospitalized unstable angina, and nonhemorrhagic stroke

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Peak Transaortic Jet Velocity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to End of follow-up (median = 4.35 years) or pre-aortic valve replacement
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change from baseline in peak transaortic jet velocity

other_outcome.description: Number of participants that experienced cardiovascular death
Number of participants that experienced aortic valve replacement (AVR)

other_outcome.measure: Congestive Heart Failure (CHF) Due to Progression of Aortic Stenosis (AS)
other_outcome.description: Number of participants that experienced Congestive Heart Failure (CHF) due to progression of aortic stenosis (AS)
Number of participants that experienced nonfatal myocardial infarction (MI)
Number of participants that experienced coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG)
Number of participants that experienced percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI)
Number of participants that experienced hospitalization for unstable angina
Number of participants that experienced nonhemorrhagic stroke
Number of participants that died (any cause)

other_outcome.measure: Percent Change in Time Weighted Average Total Cholesterol From Baseline to End of Follow-up
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to End of follow-up (median = 4.35 years)
other_outcome.description: Mean percent change (time-weighted average over follow-up) from baseline: Time-weighted average calculated using values at week 8, week 24, year 1 and every 6 months with time interval (days) between 2 successive values used as the weighting factor. For the first follow-up value, the weight was the number of days from randomization.

other_outcome.measure: Percent Change in Time Weighted Average Low-density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (LDL-C) From Baseline to End of Follow-up
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to End of follow-up (median = 4.35 years)
other_outcome.description: Mean percent change (time-weighted average over follow-up) from baseline: Time-weighted average calculated using values at week 8, week 24, year 1 and every 6 months with time interval (days) between 2 successive values used as the weighting factor. For the first follow-up value, the weight was the number of days from randomization.

other_outcome.measure: Percent Change in Time Weighted Average High-density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (HDL-C) From Baseline to End of Follow-up
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to End of follow-up (median = 4.35 years)
other_outcome.description: Mean percent change (time-weighted average over follow-up) from baseline: Time-weighted average calculated using values at week 8, week 24, year 1 and every 6 months with time interval (days) between 2 successive values used as the weighting factor. For the first follow-up value, the weight was the number of days from randomization.

other_outcome.measure: Percent Change in Time Weighted Average Triglycerides From Baseline to End of Follow-up
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to End of follow-up (median = 4.35 years)
other_outcome.description: Mean percent change (time-weighted average over follow-up) from baseline: Time-weighted average calculated using values at week 8, week 24, year 1 and every 6 months with time interval (days) between 2 successive values used as the weighting factor. For the first follow-up value, the weight was the number of days from randomization.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged 45 to 85 with mild abnormalities of the aortic valve as confirmed by an echocardiogram.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients previously in a trial using the study drug, or currently taking any medications that are not allowed in this study.

reference.citation: Rossebø AB, Pedersen TR, Boman K, Brudi P, Chambers JB, Egstrup K, Gerdts E, Gohlke-Bärwolf C, Holme I, Kesäniemi YA, Malbecq W, Nienaber CA, Ray S, Skjaerpe T, Wachtell K, Willenheimer R; SEAS Investigators. Intensive lipid lowering with simvastatin and ezetimibe in aortic stenosis. N Engl J Med. 2008 Sep 25;359(13):1343-56. doi: 10.1056/NEJMoa0804602. Epub 2008 Sep 2.

Steine K, Rossebø AB, Stugaard M, Pedersen TR. Left ventricular systolic and diastolic function in asymptomatic patients with moderate aortic stenosis. Am J Cardiol. 2008 Oct 1;102(7):897-901. doi: 10.1016/j.amjcard.2008.07.001. Epub 2008 Aug 26.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Phase III. Study Initiation Date (FPI) was 06-Jan-2003 and Study Completion Date (LPO) was 17-Apr-2008. Primary therapy period 02-Mar-2001 to 31-Mar-2008 includes start date of therapy from the Simvastatin in Aortic Stenosis (SAS) study. 173 study centers worldwide (Denmark, Finland, Germany, Great Britain, Ireland, Norway, and Sweden)
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Included patients with asymptomatic aortic stenosis as assessed on echocardiography, not requiring lipid-lowering therapy, and without known coronary heart disease or diabetes mellitus. 4 week placebo/diet run-in period was followed by treatment period lasting until 4 years after the last patient was randomized.

outcome.title: Number of Participants That Experienced One or More Components of the Composite Clinical Endpoint of MCE (Major Cardiovascular Events)
outcome.description: Composite endpoint of MCE consists of cardiovascular death, AVR (aortic valve replacement) surgery, CHF(congestive heart failure) as a result of progression of aortic stenosis, nonfatal MI (myocardial infarction), CABG (coronary artery bypass) surgery, PCI (percutaneous coronary intervention), hospitalized unstable angina, and nonhemorrhagic stroke

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Peak Transaortic Jet Velocity
outcome.description: Mean change from baseline in peak transaortic jet velocity
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to End of follow-up (median = 4.35 years) or pre-aortic valve replacement
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set: All patients who were randomized, took at least one dose of blinded study therapy and had a baseline and at least one post-randomization assessment without regard to protocol violations or compliance with study medication. 180 patients were excluded from peak transaortic jet velocity due to missing measurements.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Peak Transaortic Jet Velocity
measure.description: Mean change from baseline in peak transaortic jet velocity
measure.population: Full Analysis Set: All patients who were randomized, took at least one dose of blinded study therapy and had a baseline and at least one post-randomization assessment without regard to protocol violations or compliance with study medication. 180 patients were excluded from peak transaortic jet velocity due to missing measurements.

analysis.method_desc: Model terms: treatment and baseline peak transaortic jet velocity
analysis.estimate_desc: Direction of the Comparison: EZ/Simva 10/40 mg minus Placebo

outcome.title: Percent Change in Time Weighted Average Total Cholesterol From Baseline to End of Follow-up
outcome.description: Mean percent change (time-weighted average over follow-up) from baseline: Time-weighted average calculated using values at week 8, week 24, year 1 and every 6 months with time interval (days) between 2 successive values used as the weighting factor. For the first follow-up value, the weight was the number of days from randomization.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to End of follow-up (median = 4.35 years)
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set: All patients who were randomized, took at least one dose of blinded study therapy and had a baseline and at least one post-randomization assessment without regard to protocol violations or compliance with study medication.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Lung squamous cell carcinoma stage unspecified
Mental disorder due to a general medical condition

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Merck agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Merck supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: It is important to note that several of the ischemic outcomes making up the composite ischemic endpoint can occur as a causal consequence of aortic stenosis progression itself, or in association with its standard treatment (aortic valve replacement).

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
